page.title: 19Brownsea Castle
page.content: There was originally a Tudor Castle on this site,built by Henry VIII. The Castle later became a private house, and finally became almost derelict. It is nowadays owned by the National Trust, who lease it to the John Lewis Partnership. The castle has been restored and renovated, and is used as a holiday centre for employees of John Lewis and their families. In 1985 the charge is Â£19.00 per day. Between March and September about 70 guests are staying at the Castle, for up to a fortnight's holiday, with 30 staff to serve food and lay on amusements. Some holidays include a visit to Poole Regatta, or painting tuition, country dancing displays and a fancy-dress ball. The Castle contains a Muniments Room with files of archives and newspaper cuttings concerning the building.
